column1: Dongyang  (simplified Chinese: 东阳; traditional Chinese: 東陽; pinyin: Dōngyáng; lit.: 'east sun') is a county-level city of about 804
column2: 398 people in the center of Zhejiang Province
column3: about 200 kilometers south of Hangzhou. It covers an area of 1
column4: 744.05 km2 (673.38 sq mi) and administers eleven towns
column6: and six subdistricts. It is part of the Yangtze River Delta Economic Region.

column2: made of Dongying and the neighboring city of Yiwu

column1: Dongyang county was first set up in AD 195 (2nd year of XinPing Reign of East Han Dynasty) and known as Wuning (吴宁). In AD 688
column2: the name was changed to Dongyang (东阳). The name Dongyang means "Eastern Sun".

column11: Hengdian (横店镇)The only township is Sandan Township (三单乡)

column1: Dongyang is home to numerous construction companies
column2: the primary one being Zhongtian. Dongyang also produces magnets
column5: garments and agriculture and wooden sculptures.

column1: The reform and opening policies of the 1970s have accelerated economic growth
column2: and the city ranks among the top 100 cities in China
column3: and the first well-off counties (cities) in Zhejiang Province. In 2005
column4: the city's GDP reached 15.984 billion RMB yuan
column5: earning fiscal revenue of 1.38 billion RMB yuan. Per-capita disposable income for urban households totaled 13
column7: and per-capita net income for farmers amounted to 6

column1: Industry is a major component of Dongyang's economy. The city boasts a wide range of industrial sectors
column5: and medical and chemical industries.  At present
column6: Dongyang has become the largest magnetic material production and exportation base in China. It is also the third largest medical and pharmaceutical city in Zhejiang
column7: and boasts a group of leading companies in this sphere
column8: such as Hengdian Kangyu Pharmaceutical Co.Ltd

column1: Dongyang is experiencing a period of great growth
column2: comparable to other regions and cities in Eastern China. In the city square (called Holman Chen)
column3: many couples on pleasant evenings dance to traditional and Chinese pop songs.
there is a famous movie studio
column4: where many films and TV shows about ancient China are made. Considered the Hollywood of the East
column5: this vast movie set is a great day trip that is usually very quiet and empty. The movie set is home to a recreation of the Summer Palace
column7: an ancient Chinese Village and several small European Villages as well as a Pirate ship in a man-made lake. The movie Hero
column8: starring Jet Li was filmed there
column9: as well as the recent video game adaptation.

column1: Huawei electronics has a large campus in Dongyang
column2: one of its factories had a large industrial fire.

column1: Lu Residential Complex (卢宅) is one of the key historical and cultural sites under state-level protection in China. Located in downtown Dongyang
column2: the great architectural complex has been the habitation for the Lu family since 800 years ago. It is well known as the Imperial Palace in South China. It is composed of six groups of buildings. The residential complex is ancient
column5: and the buildings inside dating from Ming and Qing Dynasties feature the typical Ming-Qing architectural style.

column1: Hengdian World Studios (横店影视城) is the Hollywood in China. The magnificent and elaborately-designed bases and modernized studios there have attracted many directors both from home and abroad. More than 400 films were shot in Hengdian World Studios
Dongyang also has Baiyun Cultural Park
column2: a place for relaxation with several representations of Daoism and Buddhism including a 50-foot statue.

column1: Dongyang Woodcarving (东阳木雕) is reputed as one of the best folk handicrafts and a national treasure
column2: as one of the four major schools of woodcarving in China. Dongyang has been honored as the hometown of woodcarving since ancient time. Dongyang Woodcarving came into being early in Tang Dynasty. In Song Dynasty
column3: it became state of the art. During the Ming and Qing Dynasties

column1: A famous local tradition in Dongyang is the virgin boy egg (Chinese: 童子尿煮鸡蛋; pinyin: Tóngzǐ Niào Zhǔ Jīdàn)
column2: an annual tradition in early spring time where the urine of prepubertal school boys preferably under 10 years is collected and boiled with eggs and then sold (for 1.50 yuan around twice the price of a regular boiled egg.) and eaten
column3: it is said "it tastes like spring". In 2008
column4: Dongyang recognized the eggs as "local intangible cultural heritage."

column1: Dongyang is approximately five hours by train from Shanghai
column2: where it is also possible to catch a long-distance bus. Close to Dongyang is Yiwu
column3: which is a 25-minute bus ride away.  Hangzhou is approximately two hours' travel from Dongyang.
